hints_html: Remember that the derivative of a function is the slope of that function.
hints_latex:
Remember that the derivative of a function is the slope of that
function.
hints_raw: Remember that the derivative of a function is the slope of that function.
question: 2 (c)
sols_html:
To draw a qualitatively accurate sketch of the derivative of the function (i.e

\[\begin{aligned} f'(x)\end{aligned}\]

), we need to observe some qualitative features of the slope:

(1) We notice that the slope of the function is zero (i.e: function has a horizontal tangent line) at \(x = -1\) and \(x = 1\). (i.e

\[\begin{aligned} f'(x) = 0\end{aligned}\]

at \(x = -1\) and \(x = 1\))

(2) We notice the function has positive slope on \((-1,1)\) (i.e

\[\begin{aligned} f'(x) > 0\end{aligned}\]

on \((-1,1)\))

(3) We notice the function has negative slope on \((-3,-1)\cup (1,3)\) (i.e

\[\begin{aligned} f'(x) < 0\end{aligned}\]

on \((-3,-1)\cup (1,3)\)).

So we need to sketch a curve for \(f'(x)\) that the properties described in points (1)-(3). Such a curve is plotted in black below.
sols_latex:
To draw a qualitatively accurate sketch of the derivative of the
function (i.e\begin{align*}
f'(x)
\end{align*}), we need to observe some qualitative features of
the slope:

(1) We notice that the slope of the function is zero (i.e: function has
a horizontal tangent line) at $x = -1$ and $x = 1$. (i.e\begin{align*}
f'(x) = 0
\end{align*} at
$x = -1$ and $x = 1$)

(2) We notice the function has positive slope on $(-1,1)$
(i.e\begin{align*}
f'(x) > 0
\end{align*} on $(-1,1)$)

(3) We notice the function has negative slope on $(-3,-1)\cup (1,3)$
(i.e\begin{align*}
f'(x) < 0
\end{align*} on $(-3,-1)\cup (1,3)$).

So we need to sketch a curve for $f'(x)$ that the properties described
in points (1)-(3). Such a curve is plotted in black below.

\includegraphics[width=0.5\textwidth]{../json_data/MATH102/December_2011/MATH102_2011_2c_sol.png}
sols_raw:
To draw a qualitatively accurate sketch of the derivative of the function (i.e: <math>f'(x)</math>), we need to observe some qualitative features of the slope:

(1) We notice that the slope of the function is zero (i.e: function has a horizontal tangent line) at  <math>x = -1</math> and <math>x = 1</math>. (i.e: <math>f'(x) = 0</math> at  <math>x = -1</math> and <math>x = 1</math>)

(2) We notice the function has positive slope on <math>(-1,1)</math> (i.e: <math>f'(x) > 0</math> on <math>(-1,1)</math>)

(3) We notice the function has negative slope on <math>(-3,-1)\cup (1,3)</math> (i.e: <math>f'(x) < 0</math> on <math>(-3,-1)\cup (1,3)</math>).

So we need to sketch a curve for <math>f'(x)</math> that the properties described in points (1)-(3). Such a curve is plotted in black below.

[[File:MATH102 2011 2c sol.png]]
statement_html: Consider the function in the graph shown below. Draw a qualitatively accurate sketch of its derivative on top of it.
statement_raw:
Consider the function in the graph shown below. Draw a qualitatively accurate sketch of its derivative on top of it.
